doc.field: Chichen Itza is huge - a little city of ruins.

This is one of the other pyramids at Chichen Itza. I thought we were just going to see a single pyramid but was surprised and delighted to find that Chichen Itza is a more of a little city of ruins.

This is one of the other pyramids at Chichen Itza. I thought we were just going to see a single pyramid but was surprised and delighted to find that Chichen Itza is a more of a little city of ruins.

You need to buy two tickets to get into Chichen Itza - one for the state and another for the government - Huh? I thought those were the same thing.
pictures vacation canon mexico photo ruins image photos picture yucatan playadelcarmen powershot chichenitza valladolid adobe cancun pyramids s90 lightroom quintanaroo moik 2011 adobelightroom
Get Your Ticket To Chichen Itza

Ian enjoying the Temple of Kukulkan in Chichen Itza. It isn't easy for a five year old to spend an entire day looking at ancient ruins. He was a perfect kid all day. Here he is climbing into what I recall was formerly a purification bath before going up to the Platform of Venus (??)

pictures vacation canon mexico ian photo ruins image photos picture yucatan playadelcarmen powershot chichenitza valladolid adobe cancun pyramids s90 lightroom quintanaroo moik 2011 adobelightroom platformofvenus templeofkukulkan
Ian Did A Great Job At Chichen Itza

Great Ball Court Archaeologists have identified several courts for playing the Mesoamerican ballgame in Chichén, but the Great Ball Court about 150 metres (490 ft) to the north-west of the Castillo is by far the most impressive. It is the largest ball court in ancient Mesoamerica. It measures 166 by 68 metres (545 × 223 ft). The imposing walls are 12 metres (39 ft) high, and in the center, high up on each of the long walls, are rings carved with intertwining serpents. From Wikipedia

The Great Ball Court - Chichen Itza

Apparently this was the hoop they had to get the ball through in order to score. It was quite high - looks like a difficult game and the stakes were high.
